items.title: How life has changed for one Jewish man in Australia
items.description: The rise in antisemitism in Australia since October 7 has reshaped the way Gaby Silver's family lives. After the Bondi attack, they're even more on edge.

items.title: How the Bondi shooters got access to now-banned guns
items.description: With Australia's strict gun laws, how was Sajid Akram able to legally own the gun he was using to slaughter innocent people in Bondi on December 14?

items.title: Two girls were separated from their dad at Bondi. It's a scene that is hard to forget
items.description: These are the stories of everyday people who stepped up during dark times, and of a community coming together when two gunmen sought to tear them apart on December 14.

items.title: Live: Hundreds of lifesavers hold silent vigil for Bondi victims
items.description: Hundreds of surf lifesavers have gathered on Bondi Beach to pay tribute to the victims of last Sunday's terrorist attack. Follow live.

items.title: Albanese not the only one facing a reckoning over Bondi terror
items.description: While Albanese will forever struggle to shed the perception that he was too slow to recognise the threat to Australia's Jewish community — he is taking action.

items.title: Live: Clinton portraits, grocery lists published in partially released Epstein files
items.description: A trove of documents about the investigation into sex offender Jeffrey Epstein and his co-conspirator, Ghislaine Maxwell, has been published. Follow live as we analyse the files and the fallout.

items.title: Extreme heat, humidity and storms ahead of Christmas Day
items.description: Australia is experiencing a smorgasbord of wild weather in the lead-up to Christmas, featuring extreme heat, humidity, severe thunderstorms, and tropical storms all on the cards.

items.title: Parents grapple with Australia's social media ban
items.description: For some parents, the social media bans for under-16s have come as a relief. But others say they are fuelling conflict.

items.title: Travball don't lie: Travis Head has become Australia's most beloved cricketer
items.description: Travis Head, last of the larrikins, is revelling in a summer of love as another glorious Ashes century guides his team ever closer to the urn.

items.title: Deaths of two Aboriginal brothers with disability reveals systemic failures
items.description: The NT coroner makes nine recommendations following an inquest into the deaths of two disabled Aboriginal brothers who spent a number of years homeless in Alice Springs.

items.title: Grace Tame fights against a legal loophole frustrating abuse survivors
items.description: In every Australian state and the NT, churches cannot be held vicariously liable for historical child sexual abuse perpetrated by their priests. Grace Tame is leading the charge for change.

items.title: 'Why on Earth would we do it?': This scientist is trying to figure out kissing
items.description: Why is swapping saliva something all human societies have normalised? Turns out kissing isn't just a human thing — all sorts of species appear to kiss, and new research suggests Neanderthals did it too.

items.title: Why this 'powerhouse' of women's Aussie Rules is at risk of folding
items.description: Melbourne University is the latest women’s Aussie Rules club fighting for survival, but it is hoping intervention from an AFL executive can turn the club’s fortunes around.

items.title: Records tumble as Heat pulls off stunning BBL run chase at the Gabba
items.description: Matt Renshaw and Jack Wildermuth pull off one of the greatest run chases in T20 history in a stunning Big Bash match at the Gabba.

items.title: How 'half-brained' thieves snatched a $50m Picasso in under four minutes
items.description: The 2007 Brazilian heist was not the last time a nimble thief made off with a Picasso. And as many Melburnians know, it certainly wasn't the first.

items.title: Fight on to save these 'vacuum cleaners of the river' from extinction
items.description: A team of environmental experts, Indigenous rangers and conservation detection dogs is working on recovering the population of native freshwater turtles.

items.title: Former patients and families 'waiting for justice' after report into mental hospital
items.description: Brisbane's Wolston Park Mental Hospital closed in 2001, but a 12-month review has shed light on its history of sexual abuse and patient mistreatment.

items.title: Dreams shattered as 140 Zone RV caravan customers' worst fears realised
items.description: About 140 customers of Zone RV have been told they will not be receiving their caravans after the company collapsed.

items.title: 'Better than anything Russia has got': Australian tanks arrive in Ukraine
items.description: The ABC is granted exclusive access to the ADF operation to transport M1A1 Abrams tanks to Ukraine, via Poland, which included an ocean voyage of more than 50 days.

items.title: EU to lend Ukraine $160b after plan to mobilise Russian assets unravels
items.description: EU leaders agree to provide a massive interest-free loan to Ukraine to meet its military and economic needs for the next two years after failing to reach an agreement on the use of frozen Russian assets.

items.title: Three people dead in Taipei Metro station stabbing attack
items.description: The suspect is also dead after falling from a building during a police chase.

items.title: Luigi Mangione's pre-trial hearing triggers long wait for a ruling
items.description: Prosecutors presented evidence from Luigi Mangione's arrest, including a suspected murder weapon, but the defence wants these items excluded from the trial.

items.title: Thousands of dollars in pay rises awarded to Queensland mayors and councillors
items.description: The salary increases will see smaller council representatives given a 4.5 per cent pay rise, with 3.25 per cent raises on offer for larger council areas.

items.title: This robot is designed to do your chores, but would you trust it?
items.description: Humanoid robots may be part of our future, but human psychology and the uncanny valley may stand between them and world domination.

items.title: Ex-Neighbours star Damien Richardson sentenced over Nazi gesture
items.description: Damien Richardson agreed to a restorative justice program, which will require him to apologise to the Jewish community and attend therapy.
